Reviews.Title: “I liked it with buts'”
Reviews.Author: dexion
Reviews.Content: Yes... I liked hotel but it is true that hotel smells like an old cupboard, found staff at the reception desk very reserved and "cold". An internet connection was crap and you have to pay it extra (10 euro per day), the signal was disappearing every couple of minutes so none of my emails were sent successfully and you have to go through the silly procedure every single time you are trying to connect. WC/shower/ sink different and not really me but for a weekend it was acceptable. Great location and funky approach and I dont know what else but there is a thing in this hotel which is making you loving it Good luck ;-)

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: sc1217
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely helpful which was refreshing brought us up a lghter several times. Food menu was not great but lovely cafes and restaurants 2 mins walk away. Rooms clean and functional i personally loved the design of the bathroom would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Very good price/quality in the middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ToonPuissant
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff are very friendly, the lobby music automatically puts you in a happy mood, the rooms were spacious, clean and well-designed. We stayed in a superior room and found it to be excellent price-quality ratio. The hotel is in an excellent location, very near the Alexanderplatz so easy access to all kinds of public transport. We dit not try the bar/restaurant so cannot comment on that. In stead of having breakfast in the hotel, we went to Oliv around the corner where you can have excellent breakfast for approximately half the price of the hotel breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “A bit over-rated and over-designed”
Reviews.Author: jgdd
Reviews.Content: The hotel website makes you think you're going to stay in quite a luxurious hotel. I was dissappointed by the extremely sparse, almost prison-like room. The rug around the bed was filthy and the floor marked. I also didn't like the shower open onto the room and the toilet tucked away - may be personal taste. The staff were quite rude on reception. Wouldn't stay here again, plenty of better, cheaper options in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice "posh" hotel in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ttvvuu
Reviews.Content: The Lux11 is located directly in the center of Berlin. The Hackesche Höfe, the TV tower at the Alexanderplatz and lots of nice and original shops at Münzstraße and Alte Schönhauser Straße are located just around the corner. Depeding which room you booḱ you have either some traffic noise or a nice balcony to the back. The rooms are spacious and modern furnished (including dishwasher and a stove where you could cook small meals and a coffee maker). The famous "Spreewaldgurken" (Spreewald cucumbers) are complimentary, the minibar (some drinks and crisps) is quite expensive). Unforunately my room did not have a fullsize mirror so I had to step on my bed to check my outfit. The bed is comfortable with lots of different cushions. The shower is a "rainshower", very nice. The breakfast is EUR 14 which is quite expensive. When we had breakfast at 10:30h (it is served until 11h) the buffet was almost empty and only after asking the staff if some more eggs were available the quite slow staff arranged some more food. I would recommend to just walk around the corner to one of the nice and very cheap street cafes for breakfast. The hotel is sponsored by Adidas (you will receive a voucher for the Adidas Flagship Store around the corner) the staff is dressed completely in Adidas which is a quite unusual sight (even the cleaning personal wears green training suits). The hairdresser in the ground floor (Beate Kahlcke) is quite expensive but very good (an Aveda salon) so I can recommend it if you plan to have a nice 'do for the evening. All in all the Lux11 is a good starting point for your city trip to Berlin. The rooms are quite big, very modern and clean and the location is just perfect (but kind of noisy but that's the price for living so central). Check in advance when your room will be available - we were told that they would be available at 4pm (quite late) but when asking if it would be possible to check in earlier, we could check in at 2pm).

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance.....and quite exposed!!!”
Reviews.Author: schloofer
Reviews.Content: The Lux 11 has a very funky and inviting website, leading you to believe you are to be staying in quite an impressive boutique hotel, but to be perfectly honest I was quite unimpressed by the hotel in person. As far as the location, this was great, right near the subway and within easy walking distance to most of the sights. However, if you want any kind of privacy on your stay DO NOT STAY HERE. There is absolutely no privacy whatsoever when showering. The shower and wash basin area are all part of the bedroom and have no door or curtain to separate the two. Whoever you are staying with will have the pleasure (or not so much!) of watching you shower, and vice versa!!! You will be happy to know however that the toilet has a sliding door! I felt as if the hotel was more style over substance. They did add nice touches like the White Company products to use and some lovely slippers and everything looked quite clean, modern and funky but I wouldn't say it was anything to write home about and, as above, the room may have looked funky but really was not practical. To add to the impracticality of the room, there were no drawers in our room, only a small hanging wardrobe area with a shelf above (and ours was not a standard room, but a deluxe one). The staff did help us out with anything we asked for. I found them to be pleasant. However the hotel to me is more of an apartment complex. The rooms are set up with kitchen areas for you to use as you wish. I think this would be more suited to people needing this type of facility. The hotel also has a salon and a restaurant attached, none of which I used though. Other than that I was not aware of any hotel facilities other than a wash room (the iron of which nearly burnt a whole through my dress and I overheard one guest saying his clothes were stuck in the washing machine as the door handle had broken!!!). If you want a luxury hotel with good facilities I wouldn't recommend it. If you want somewhere in a good location that looks funky and has kitchen facilities in the room (and you don't mind being exposed when showering) then go for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Carlamaisondecharme
Reviews.Content: Lux 11 is a wonderful place to stay when visiting Berlin. Good location on a quiet street, easy to reach by tram and metro. It is a small, boutique/design Hotel, the staircase has an old look, but once you enter the room comes a real surprise: neat and modern furniture and a dreamlike shower with luxury amenities. I shall certainly return there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great,but no 4 starss”
Reviews.Author: Bhoroosterman
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks great, perfect location.room good, we found the bed really awful, and the pillows really bad. We did asked extra pillows. Toiletries are really good brand, but not replaced after 1 day,really strange. The breakfast buffet to small for the price, better find a nicer, cheaper,better place to have breakfast. Staff really nice, helpfull. It's a nice hotel, I dont't think worth 4 stars. But the strangest thing is, the'll let you pay, the absurd amound of 10 euro a day per Phone,iPad,computer to use the internet......seriously,,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of luxary in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Nessy2kn1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Berlin and had an amazing time, the hotel playing a major part in our experience. The room we stayed in was stunning with lots of modern features and luxuries. The apartment was modern, clean well laid out with a good kitchen facility in the room (with a dish washer). The location was in a trend area of Berlin with lots of boutiques and trendy bars. However not to far from the centre of Berlin and the train station. I cant recomend this hotel enough, I would defiantly return or recommend to a friend. We were not dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “LAX not LUX”
Reviews.Author: satisfied21
Reviews.Content: If you expect an ounce of customer service at this hotel you will be disappointed. I arrived after a 24 hour flight with heavy luggage and not one of the four staff behind the desk assisted me to my room. They were too busy chatting! I had to repeatedly ask for skirt hangers (which I am still waiting for) and I had to remind them daily that I needed an extra top sheet - they give you a king size bed and only have single duvets. No room service for breakfast and a total of only 8 dishes on the menu for room service which varied in its quality and quantity. I asked if they were bus tours that I could take to see the attractions in Berlin and was told no. I asked them to make an appointment for me at a spa and had to follow up 24 hours later to find out that nothing was done. There is a definite lack of hotel management at this so called 'Lux' hotel. I was so frustrated I almost moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We work too hard to have service this lame”
Reviews.Author: ekimberle
Reviews.Content: I'm here now at Lux 11. Doing laundry in the free self serve laundry room. It is giving me better customer service than any human I've encountered here. The rooms are fine but nothing special. Today I lost my cell phone & needed to call the front desk 5 times before they could correctly tell me how to make an international call from the land line in the room, the four previous instructions they gave me were incorrect. I had to ask 3 times for a hair dryer that worked. That took over an hour. So it's fine of you know Berlin & don't need anything, but it's not worth the money. The front desk staff is like meeting your guy friend's new girlfriend. She smiles and hugs you and says how great it is to meet you when you're introduced, but her eyes say, 'go away!'. Spend a bit more and go to Hotel Casa Camper--an AMAZING staff. Spend less and go to Motel One for better service. This is a last resort place at best.

Reviews.Title: “My most favourite hotel in all of Europe...”
Reviews.Author: tooks_meri
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a decent amount, and have stayed in some nice properties but Lux 11 is by far my favourite. It's not for those that want the big brand hotels, with hundreds of rooms and all night room service. It's a cool, funky hotel, that is a lot of fun, great staff, nice bar, nice breakfasts, great location... It's modern, yet the building itself has a charm about it. I don't think there's anything more you can ask for. I'm so glad i could stay here and i will recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & interior design”
Reviews.Author: mary_kGermany
Reviews.Content: We loved our weekend stay at Lux 11! The location could not be better, the staff were friendly and the minimalist interior design makes it very special. An extra highlight were the Aveda bath & shower products.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet, we will be back here”
Reviews.Author: Joeribegood
Reviews.Content: The Lux 11 is a perfect stay right in the middle of cool urban hangouts in the Berlin Mitte area. Together with a buddy of mine we did a serious nightlife tour through Berlin and needed a cool yet flexible hotel. When you wake up at 12:00 and they still offer you breakfast you know that you are in the right place. The staff is super friendly, relaxed and walk around in Adidas training suits. I had a big room with a little kitchen in it (so I guess young families could stay here as well) and nice modern but warm interior. The food was top notch and the bar looked straight out of a Star Trek movie but in a good way. I travel a lot for my work and end up in hip posh hotels but they lack a certain freedom feel which I found here. So yes it's a safe bet, and walking distance from the famous rooftop Weekend club! Will be back Joeri

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Speere
Reviews.Content: We stayed luckily only for one night at the Lux 11 and were disappointed. I have to say that from the pictures we saw in the web we had very high expectations but then found the rooms to be old and very worn down (if not to say scruffy). I would not go back here even though the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck here again - still terrible”
Reviews.Author: DoubleBakedPork
Reviews.Content: Having had a terrible experience here in the past so was very unhappy to find out that I was booked into the Lux 11 for a stay by a company I am consulting for in Berlin. In short, this hotel is still a bad place. The rooms are nice. It's the mean and dishonest management that is the problem here. In short, this hotel should be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Bland and average at Lux 11”
Reviews.Author: chick_chickDubai
Reviews.Content: Lux 11 is part of the Design Hotels. When I watched the video on the website, I was really drawn to the place and booked a room immediately as my partner and I were going to Berlin for a Hotel conference. I would however like to share with you some quotes that were shown on their marketing video which is on the Design Hotels website: "In the end, everything depends on the people" (Quote by co-founder Elmo Hagendorf) "It's a people's business" (Quote by co founder Tom Tanzer) "We don't do hotels, we create concepts" After my stay at Lux 11, I can say that out of the three above quotes, only one of them is true. In my opinion, this hotel is anything but a people's business. The service wasn't bad, it just isn't great. They pass the minimum satisfactory level, but in a luxury boutique hotel, one would expect much better. The blonde receptionist was cold as the temperature outside - 0 degrees. She was also quite defensive at times with no sense of humour By the way, Lux 11 isn't a hotel. They market themselves as an apart/hotel but decide when it's best for them to be a hotel or apartments. Therefore, your expectations and then your experience of the place is somewhat confusing. The bedrooms are very design-led. The shower is right next to the bed so you have a bit of a problem if your partner wakes up earlier than you to take a shower, because you have to switch on all the lights in the bedroom. I cannot deny however that the quality of all the furnishings were to a high quality. So to the third quote "We don't do hotels, we create concepts". I completely agree, Lux 11 don't do hotels - they do apartments.

Reviews.Title: “I agree, overrated.”
Reviews.Author: misora
Reviews.Content: We came at the recommendation of a friend who is pretty picky about his choice of chic hotels, therefore thought that i would be looking forward to an excellent stay. First of all, the location was ok, just next to Alexanderplatz which has the U-bahn and S-bahn main station; the restaurants were also pretty good, especially in the asian food section. The rooms were ok, spacious and clean overall. What annoyed me was the service. There are only two ppl in service after evening time (one was friendly but the other one was pretty cold and unhelpful), and everytime i needed something they asked me go to the reception to get it myself. They charged me a 10euros deposit just for borrowing an ethernet cable and said that if i didnt' bring it back to the reception or left it in the room when i checked out, the 10 euros would be charged. Also, we noticed that the housekeeping didn't replace our shampoo and shower gel after a few days, and when we asked for it at the reception, they gave us some and told us that they weren't supposed to replace those normally. How ridiculous. For the price we are paying, the service is pretty lousy. It isn't the best hotel we have stayed in and next time i come to berlin i would probably search for another one with warmer smiles.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, modern hotel, relaxed urban luxury”
Reviews.Author: AneleIkirak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just as described at their website. Our room was a corner room on the last floor, as I had requested. Early check-in was a piece of cake, and all of the receptionists were very polite and the service was really good. The truth is that personnel have a very good base...a really nicely decorated hotel, sunny spacious room, modern environment. The room had a small kitchen with a coffee-machine. This was really appreciated! Service was really what I would expect for a 4-star hotel. I've read in another review about the sportsclothes the receptionists wear. Well, as it seems this is rather subjective, but I really liked their outfit. It helped me feel more relaxed, instead of the standard "secretary" look receptionists usually have. Speaking of subjectiveness..Regarding the modern shower that is separated with a glass and mirror from the rest of the room. It is not a big deal really, even if you travel with friends, since there are so easy ways not to have view of the person in the shower, ...watching TV, lying in bed, surfing the internet from the desk, see the beautiful view from the windows..The heating system is another thing I really enjoyed. Not only the heater is modern, but the room was so warm and sleep was so resting. I can't say really how much I like everything about the room. Check-in, check-out process were fast and smooth. The location is so convenient, too. Drawbacks? Well, usually there are some. 1) Internet is not free, which is strange for our days and for the capital city of Germany, 2) the price is rather high for Berlin, since breakfast was not included in the 130euros/night for a "deluxe" type of room (this was a special disount offer, which means that rooms cost even more)-this is expensive for Berlin, I think. 3) Everythink in the mini bar is charged..to the pricey side...4) no room service after 23:00, 5) only half of the towels were replaced with clean (3-nights stay), and the used shampoo/shower gel was not replaced two days in a row (certainly we asked and we were given)! Besides the things I didn't like, which I consider minor, I would go back to this hotel, even if it was just to see the view from that sunny room.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel if you want to stay right in "Berlin Mitte"”
Reviews.Author: travelpussy_minga
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel several times. During the last 2 years prices rose (at least during fair-season) rapidly - so I no longer go there. The location of the hotel is just perfect. - right in the heart of "Mitte" so close to the interesesting shopping area of Münzstrasse etc. It´s a hstorical building with modern interior. The staff is young, friendly, cool and helpful. The interior is "design-driven" with a lot of concrete - so not everyones taste.. Personally I like concrete very much - but during winter the room doesn´t appear cosy at all.. Another thing I don´t like is the shower which is more or less right beside of the bed (though it looks cool), I never find the right light-switch and breakfast ist according to the hotel-standard poor. Once they ran out of milk for the coffee at 8 o clock in the morning - not acceptable.. Better take your breakfast somewhere else - there are attractive options just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Hyperboy78
Reviews.Content: Went to IFA recently and stayed here with a colleague, I only stayed one night but he had been there for 6 and agrees that it was a very nice relaxing and high quality hotel. The only issue I had was having to walk down to the laundry room to iron my shirt.... in a room that is very well equipped I found it surprising that there was no iron/ironing board!?!... Overall the room design and quality was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Missed opportunities”
Reviews.Author: Ozdu
Reviews.Content: The check in staff was friendly but the check in lobby feels like being in a gym as staff is dressed in Adidas outfits (?). We had booked a suite (room 417) but the room had no no air-condition while cheaper rooms apparently had?. The bathroom lights did not work & still were not working the next day after we complained. When complaining for the 2nd time a nigh tstaff member apologized and offered us complimentary breakfast. The nexT morning staff denied this, stated that their computer system could not handle free breakfast and refused to contact the night staff person as he was sleeping. After some arguing we left them to sort it out. They initially deducted 1 scrambled eggs from our bill, what a joke and then only after complaining again they finally took breakfast of our bill. Other negatives were wireless internet use is not free, wireless log in on iPhone didn't work and staff not willing to help (must be your iPhone!). The positives were lot's of windows in room 417 but it can be noisy as you have to keep the windows open at night to get some air in the room. The room was spacious and they brought extra towels at request. A real plus was restaurant Luchs downstairs with good food and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Not so great - overrated very hot rooms no aircon and NOISEY”
Reviews.Author: danieson
Reviews.Content: This looks great on the web but when you get int your room they are small. we upgraded to a suite and were cooked each night with no air con and hot stuffy air . Window open onto noisy street that make for a horrible nights sleep. The staff in hotel are moody and they seem like they do you favour when you ask for anything. internet is 10 euro per day extra. Food at Luchs downstairs was dissapointing and expensive. trying hard to be a fashionable hotel but misses. The kitchens are tiny and impractacle oh and the showers are dangerously slippery when wet . too much design not enough thought on the basic guest needs

Reviews.Title: “Super duper stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cammi9
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. The staff was really nice and friendly, room was spacious with a sunny balcony and all in all we had a great stay. The restaurant downstair is also very nice and serves great food and wine. If you want an easy and lovely stay - this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: kslybacon
Reviews.Content: We had an overall good stay at Lux 11. I see some mixed reviews here but can't say that we experienced any of the major problems other people have complained of. Firstly I must say the location of the hotel is absolutely perfect - it is right in the middle of the action. The hotel is very modern and trendy, which is nice, except for the massive adidas ads behind reception and the blaring dance music morning, noon and night which is a bit much. The service was always good with reception helping us with reservations and directions. We also ate breakfast in the restaurant twice which was more than adequate, with very good quality breads. The rooms are minimalist which is usually relaxing but the lack of storage for clothes made for a messy couple of days - a chest of drawers would not have gone amiss. The shower is right in the bedroom which is fine for a couple but might not be for another traveling dynamic. We had a problem with the shower drain which was kinda rectified but never perfect during our stay. Overall can't say that we had a perfect experience, and it is not cheap, but equally we had a fantastic time in Berlin and the hotel was certainly adequate and the location made up for its shortcomings. I have graded it as average here but only as there is no "good" option - it did not quite merit a "very good".

Reviews.Title: “A very chic hotel right in the heart Mitte--a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: NaomiBishop
Reviews.Content: My friend & I traveled to Berlin & we're so happy to have stayed at Lux 11. It was a very, chic apartotel right in the heart of Mitte. We had dinner & drinks at the hotel's amazing restaurant, called Shiro I Shiro-a Mediterranean/Japanese fusion restaurant where I enjoyed a salmon fois gras tobiko sushi roll. Delectable! Our 'value' room was very sleek, simple, spacious & modern, equipped with a comfortable bed, a "balcony" (though it's really just a window) & a flat screen TV. The only peculiar thing was that the shower is a glass partition in the bathroom--perhaps something to think about if you're not sharing the room with a lover or close friend. The bathroom, however, is separate (with the tallest door ever) & does lend itself to privacy. The complimentary toiletries were of really high quality, so much so that we definitely packed them up & I still have them in my bathroom back home. The exterior of the building is gorgeous & lit up in pink at nighttime. The receptionists were for the most part, very nice, except for one person who was rather short with us. They offer free lighters, guides & complimentary midnight snacks of hot dogs, buns, canned pickles & tea. In our jet-lagged, whirlwind 2-day trip to Berlin, Lux 11 was perfect place for our every need: convenient, clean & tres chic without being fussy! Within walking distance, we were able to reach all of what Mitte had to offer & the fascinating surrounding neighborhoods of Berlin are easily accessible by the metro & S-Bahn. Our favorite neighborhood (& there are so many) was certainly Kreuzberg. This design hotel is definitely a great value for Mitte--would definitely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and private”
Reviews.Author: Boingy_breaks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lux 11 over New Year. It was perfect for our needs - very well situated for both the sights but also nice restaurants and bars, good sized room (we had a deluxe), enjoyed the kitchenette taking that getting up for breakfast pressure off. Mind you, they had an extremely civilized breakfast policy serving it very late into the morning, and on New Years Day it was served until 14:30!! Still kitchenette saves money and there was a nice organics store down the road to get tasty bread and cheese etc. I like a hotel where they leave you alone and this was it so if you want to be spoilt and pampered constantly it might not be for you. However they did manage to clean our room everyday even though we barely managed to get out of it until after noon. They observed the 'privacy' note which I always appreciate. Rainfall shower with Korres products which was a nice touch. Comfortable, clean and friendly. I know I've read reviews stating the opposite of this but I saw no evidence myself - the staff were all helpful. The hotel bar does allow smoking which seems a bit weird nowadays and might not be to everyone's taste - but for others surely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Hata-ita
Reviews.Content: Really dirty. The bathroom with the [--] under the water. Very Low service

Reviews.Title: “The most contemporary and well designed apartotel I've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Hyasynth
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Berlin and I am a musician, who was there to perform, and wanted to extend my stay in a hotel which makes it seem like I am home. So I chose Lux-Eleven as it is more of an apartment hotel rather than your usual hotel. In particular, I was in love with the Junior Suite, which was a large loft-style room with a divider separating the living from the sleeping area. The bathroom is semi-exposed, with stairs leading up and down to the shower/bath area. The mix of concrete and carpet, hard and soft furnishings really made this space contemporary and modern. The corner suites are fantastic with a view of the famous Alexanderplatz TV Tower. And of course, the location is splendid, in the centre of 2 of the hippest shopping and dining districts - Mitte and Prenzlauer Berg. Highly recommended for the independent traveler.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Around-Team
Reviews.Content: I am working for a little independent Film Festival in Berlin (Around the world in 14 Films) and we bring some of our international guests to this very stylish but also very charming and nice Hotel in the middle of the City. It is perfectly located for every kind of vacation! By feet it´s only a few minutes to the cool Prenzlauer Berg with all the bars, to the amazing museums of Berlin and to the Brandenburger Tor and Reichstag were history takes place as well. Next to the hotel is a cosy new restaurant with a very international and fine way of cooking. They support us from the beginning on because they are interested in art as well. It´s a very good place for an unforgetable trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and friendly with spacious rooms (apartments)”
Reviews.Author: ErikFromSweden
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and this hotel is exactly what it says to be: stylish, cool and the personnel are really welcoming and helpful. But they have apartments, not hotel rooms in that sense that the rooms are big with a walk-in closet and a kitchenett. These apartments are clean, in a nice condition and the rain shower is beautiful. Breakfast is not the best I have experienced, but definitely ok. Since I prefer staying in a hotel on my business trips (I prefer having room service, free wifi and other services at hand), I'll might not stay here again but the experience was absolutely really good. If you are looking for a stylish apartment hotel, then this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish”
Reviews.Author: amorecreek
Reviews.Content: Lux 11 is a very stylish and cool place! The staff is friendly. It's very central for clubbing (not noisy )and eating out. Stayed in a lot of hotels in Berlin the last years, this one impressed me. The price is quite high, I stayed in one of the suites.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Experience Ever. Due To Bad Owner/General Manager”
Reviews.Author: lynnsf123
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I waited so long to put it out there to the world, but after returning to Berlin last week and staying at The Circus Hotel (FANTASTIC!), I knew I had to share my horrible experience at Lux 11 with the world. Thomas Tänzer is the owner/general manager. I was with clients and colleagues on a business trip. Lux 11 looks good on the surface. The rooms were fun in look and feel. The fun and comfort stopped when the hotel's internet service went down and stayed down for nearly 24 hours. Our client was not amused and had to seek an internet cafe at midnight while severely jet lagged in a foreign place to deal with e-mails back in the States. None of the rest of the team were amused either. Not good. In the morning, I let the front desk know that if the internet was not restored by the time we returned from our meetings around 5pm, we'd have to check out. They were in agreement. When in fact 5pm hit, there was no internet. Out we had to go, but not without a fight and room charges for late check-outs. The owner/gm wouldn't come out of his office to speak to me live. Instead he used his employees to do perform his dirty work. Now, please note that The Circus Hotel, way cheaper room rates, offers FREE Internet service and even loans out laptops for FREE. Back then, we moved to the Radisson next to the Dom, where all internet services worked beautifully. The next day Thomas Tänzer called me at my request to hopefully discuss the issue and obtain an apology or a make-good of some sort. All he did was yell at me, insult me and threaten me. I politely told him that I was hanging up on him and I hung up. He had the gumption to call back. I'd say he missed the class of Customer Service 101 & Never Read the Article How To Be A Gentleman. BAD BUSINESS. BAD FORM. BAD ENERGY. Avoid this place at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - Fake Reviews - Staff Steals”
Reviews.Author: DoubleBakedPork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel and really wanted to like it. I am a collector of Adidas and this hotel has strong ties to the Adidas brand. Additionally I love to eat pickles and this hotel oddly enough has pickles in every room. I really wanted to love this hotel but it was simply not possible. The reasons being: 1) No help with luggage upon arrival or getting to room. Once I was in room and noticed it was quite small and not the suite I had expected, I asked to switch rooms. That request was honored however I had to go down and retrieve the new keys myself and move all my own luggage. Not so Lux if you ask me. 2)There were endless buttons in the room and everything was very hard to figure out. Since there was nobody to show me to my room upon arrival- none of these things were explained. Making the room dark turned out to be a task in itself. 3) I could never figure out how to turn on the Air Conditioning. Finally I inquired and they said that the remote was at the front desk and I would have to pay 15 Euros per night for use of the air conditioner. $350 per night and no complementary Air Conditioning. Not so Lux. 4) No iron or ironing board. Usually in hotels of this caliber there is one in every room or at least one can be brought within minutes by housekeeping. Not so here. At the Lux 11, there is one communal ironing board tucked away deep in the basement. So when you step out of the shower and need to iron a few wrinkles out of your shirt at the last minute before a meeting be prepared to trek to the basement and than wait for the iron to be available. 5) I left behind a solid gold lighter which a friend went to retrieve 2 hours later and they claimed to not have found it. 6) Upon reviewing my AMEX statement, I noticed a charge of 180EUROS after my checkout. They said this may be for damages to the room but they were not sure and said they would call me back, they never did. I made no damages to the room and also did not smoke in the room(I had a balcony for that) so I went ahead and initiated a dispute with AMEX for the charge. 7) They refused to give me the promised 15% off coupon for Adidas despite featuring it on their website. Since they gave me a room upgrade I was not eligible for the coupon. 8) After I posted this review initially, they sent me a threatening e-mail accusing me of consuming illicit substances in their room and threatening to call the police!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place for a stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Steff1
Reviews.Content: We were first unsure about the location but found out, that the location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing (close to Museumsinsel) and night life as well. The staff was over-average friendly and they have great amenities like midnight snacks and even excellent wine, all included, you don't have to pay anything for it and at the same time having a terrific start in the evening or a conveniant chill-out after returning. The hotel is really a design-hotel in a pretty old, but fully renovated building which was used by the soviet KGB during cold war times - spooky. Perfect melt of history and modern design.

Reviews.Title: “Lux 11 steals!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldcritic
Reviews.Content: The service at Lux 11 is, quite simply, appalling. I stayed for a few days recently and was subjected to overcharges on my card after departure. A rude, unhelpful staff acted as though they were doing me a favor allowing me to stay there. My associate stopped by to pick me up and they refused to ring my room to let me know he was there. They instead sent him up to my room, unannounced, for a rather awkward, after-shower greeting. Did I mention there were items missing after the room was cleaned? After all this stress brought onto me by the staff, I thought, boy I could use a drink right now. I'll even shell out mini-bar prices......wait! No mini bar! Just a bottle of cheap €5 white wine, sitting warm on the counter, for the bargain price of €34. Oh yeah, no room service, in it's place, a flyer telling me to "take a taxi" to a restaurant that shares owners with the hotel. Unbelievable! What a sham. Stay away. Far away.

Reviews.Title: “Room okay, staff was horrible”
Reviews.Author: gonzokent
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days in a suite in the Lux 11. The room, although sparse, was acceptable. There were problems with the safe and we had to pay extra (10 Euro per day) for air conditioning. We were expecting a package and, even though they had an email and we checked morning and evening, they returned the package to the sender because they had flopped my first and last name on their computer. Inexcusable. We were somewhat compensated on the last day but it was a very bad experience. Also, watch the cleaning staff. A few things went missing and they didn't restock the kitchen area. We had to go get supplies almost every day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, cool - a bit achingly so”
Reviews.Author: retired_backpacker
Reviews.Content: Very lovely hotel in Mitte, a stones throw from Alexanderplatz. The rooms are amazing and the showers are my favorite! The sign of the 'too cool for school' is the Adidas branded Lux 11 shell suit's the reception staff wear. My only complaint is you have to pay extra for wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Smart boutique, great location”
Reviews.Author: LGaryThomas
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay. It's a great location - a stroll to museum island etc, Mitte restaurants, and the metro. No air conditioning in most rooms - it's a conversion of an old building, which adds a bit of character. Rooms are modern; shower in the room, tea/coffee and a compact kitchen! Lovely breakfasts, very friendly and efficient staff. Book ahead for decent rates.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkhappygal
Reviews.Content: I booked the this hotel based on the reccommendation of my friend in Berlin and the photos of the hotel website. I was a little bit disappointed because the room wasn't as nice as the photos. However it was spacious and clean. They didn't have porter service so be prepared to handle your own luggage. Location is ok. Bus stops and metro stations are about 10 mins away. There are many shops in the hotel area and a few of restaurants within a couple of blocks. I booked through the bookings.com and got a better deal than booking directly through the hotel. Although they said they had wifi service throughout the hotel, you actually had to go down to the lobby if you want to get wifi service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Apartments”
Reviews.Author: EGANSMIND
Reviews.Content: Bit of delay putting my review on but I have been going through my old holiday snaps and thought this place deserves a review. I loved the white furtiture in the Junior Suite and the wall parting between the living area and the bedroom. The bath was off the wall where you step down into a huge square shaped space. Wierd. Tha staff were friendly and the restuarant looked although we didnt eat there. I booked it direct from the website and they arranged flowers for my girlfriend because it was her birthday. The flowers were fablulous. The apartment is situated near the trendy Mitte area and there are some very nice restuarants around. We would definately go back to Berlin and the Lux - very nice apartment in a very nice trendy city

Reviews.Title: “Decent design hotel - bit too sparse”
Reviews.Author: RovingDelight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lux as part of a group booking for friends attending a launch party in the City. The hotel staff were great, the breakfast is a good buffet with delicious croissants. The beds are not true king size but are ok for a couple and perfecly comfortable. Very design magazine looking room but white walls inevitable get scuffed. The bathroom is a design feature which I personally wouldn't choose, but the shower is great, loads of pressure and aboth overhead and handheld. It is open to the room but unlike other reviewers I think if you have issues with your partner seeing you in the shower thats your problem not the hotel. Location is good, Mitte is a great hub to get to everything, there is a U-Bahn and S-Bahn within a couple of minutes walk, and the best boutique shops are just round the corner. No cleaning daily but towels changed which is fine. Overall good for a weekend stay but wouldn't pay their rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful service, overpriced, bad mangement and disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: schmidtnews
Reviews.Content: First I have to say: we love boutique hotels, booked them all over the world and do not mind to pay the usually a bit steeper price for nice rooms. But staying at the Lux 11 for three nights was one of the most disappointing stays we ever had. The service was very poor to say the least, arriving we were treated more as annoying invaders rather than greeted as guests. Fhe first appointed room was not their standard square room in this category, but a corner room, that way the actual usage space of the room was tiny, no space even to put one bigger suitcase. After complaining we learned that all the other rooms in this category were booked out. We were only offered higher category rooms, for a much higher price. The prices were even much higher than the price we would have paid on the website through which we booked our room. Pointing that out to the front desk manager we were told that he cannot give us the room for that website price, since they will sell these rooms anyway for the high price. Eventually they downgraded us to the lowest category room. That room was still a bit bigger than the corner room in our booked higher category, but still was tiny, tiny, tiny. It was facing the street, even though the hotel advertises its windows as sound proof, they are not. The noise of the traffic will wake you up very early in the morning. Within three nights, we never did not get our normal category room. On top of it the personal was very rude not only to us, but to a biz partner who called in and afterwards he was connected to the wrong room. All together the rooms are not really stylish, just trying hard and even more tiny than we experienced in Tokyo or Hong Kong island and totally overpriced. The bigger rooms are ok, but even more overpriced (starting from around 300 US Dollar without breakfast). The internet charge is 40 Euros per day, about 60 US dollar.The service is poorly to say the least, up to being rude. Apparently we were not the only ones making this bad experience his was the first hotel were the management decided to downgrade us, after figuring out they do not have a decent room in the booked category - even though they had other rooms available. Our advice: Do not book Lux 11 it really spoiled our stay in Berlin! ..

Reviews.Title: “Disapponted”
Reviews.Author: mcristo
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for two nights to celebrate a part of our honeymoon. We read about the hotel in Wallpaper guide. We ended up leaving one day too early as we were so disappointed about the rooms and especially the service. Service: BAD!!! - We had to ask several times to receive a confirmation of our booking - There was no more parking spaces left for our car and they dont have valet parking. Thus, we had do drive to a near by hotel to park our car -We called to ask if it we could cancel our room for the second day and was told it would not be a problem. When we then checked the day after they wanted us to pay for the second night despite what they informed us the day before. After a long argument they agreed to cancel without penalty as promised. Rooms: Do not live up the the price -Nice design, spacey, nice colors -Shower/tub in same room next to bed (guess some people like that) -No minibar -Small kitchen if ones wants to cook -Beds short (if you are over 190cm tall your legs will stick out) All in all very poor hotel considering the price they are asking. Second day we switched to Bradenburger Hof, which was fantastic and at about the same price Will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Glamour in East Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: louisegreen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a city break last weekend. We had never been to Berlin before and unsure of the best area to stay in but our gamble payed off! This was a great area - walking distance for all the usual attractions as well as handy for great bars and restaurants A v glamarous room as well - try to get one with a bathtub if at all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: niceguy51
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive suite, which was just perfect! In addition to inspiring me to bring some of the design elements home, it provided the idea base to explore the city. In a word, Lux 11 is sleek and most certainly exclusive, but for the price, it's extremely good value. The staff and attentive and helped us book cabs and reccommend particular nightclubs, and the breakfast (for an extra 12 Euro) is well worth it. I will be returning for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Apartment Sophistication”
Reviews.Author: Leisureboy
Reviews.Content: Cutting edge style and urban sophistication make this apartment/hotel a fitting complement to trendy East Berlin/Mitte. We chose the Executive Suite which was spacious and cleverly designed with an interior wall housing 2 flat screen TVs dividing the living room/kitchenette from the bedroom/bathroom. It feels like a modern urban studio apartment. Bright and airy with tall celings and large windows with city views and efficient blackout draperies for night time. Be aware that during the summer there is no AC. Somewhat awkward open concept bathroom requiring climbing two stairs to reach the sunken spatub/shower and then a large step down into the tub which takes a bit of careful maneuvering, particularly with wet feet! Quiet building with comfortable king bed and luxe linens. Two blocks from the Rosa-Luxemburg U-Bahn stop make for easy commuting. Interesting theater (Volksbuhne) nearby and several cafes and trendy shopping. Ultra hip Shiro i Shiro restaurant is in the lobby of the building, along with an Aveda Salon. The staff were pleasant, helpful and multi-lingual. Contrary to the website information, the staff were present even at late hours and serviced our room each day. The common space feels like an apartment building with elevator and funky pink lighting in the foyer. This property is a good choice for those who like something different, appreciate non-traditional accomodations with fresh urban, modern design and don't require heavy service-focused ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Apart-hotels are the way forward....”
Reviews.Author: harryandberyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lux for our anniversary and loved every minute of it. No maids fussing over you all the time, disturbing your restful sleep after a very late night/early morning out in Berlin. No one coming and tidying up your room whilst you're out so it feels more like your room (the bed wasn't changed in the three days we stayed, but who changes their bed at home every three days?). As other reviews have stated, if you like room service, don't stay here. But if you like getting away and feeling like the room you have is your own then this is perfect. Nicely designed without being over the top and therefore dating quickly. We had a massive room with kitchenette and walk in bath. The hotel is perfectly located for the former East berlin and all it's funky districts and sights and it's not that far to walk to the Brandenburg gate and on into the west. The restaurant attached does great fusion food and the whole experience converted me to the apart-hotel concept. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “very nice vacation in berlin and in the Lux 11”
Reviews.Author: vanHost
Reviews.Content: I have visited the apartment house Lux 11 in Sep. 2007, one month ago. On my arrival day I realized that the hotel is not very easy to find for a person who has not been in the city befor. On the outside of the hotel are no signes which show you that you are at the right place. But when I entered the entrance of the hotel I was quiet impressed, the entrance was very colorfull and the staff welcomed me with a big smile on their faces. I felt very comfortable in the atmospere of the Lux 11. The staff made a very friendly and relaxed impression on me. The apartments are stylish and cleand well. On my second day of vacation I started with a brekfast in the restaurant of the hotel. There I got the chance to choose between a large variety of food and drinks. I was able to produce my own waffles and my own orange juice, for exampel. When I had finished my breafast I decided to look arund, to get a better picture of the area. I´ve visited lots of famous buildings, museums and stores, which were all easy to reach by bus or train. All in all I can say that I had a very nice vacation in Berlin and in the Lux 11. The friendly atmosphere helped me to feel comfortable in the hotel and I can say that I would recomment the hotel to everyone who want´s to have a pleasent stay in Berlin. If you want to get an impression of the hotel by yourself it might be helpful to take a look at the website [---] because there you can find a very detailed description of the hotel with lots of pictures. Enjoy your vacation as much as I have done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Space”
Reviews.Author: CamelSD
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via an Agent's website, which gave the hotel an excellent review and we weren't disappointed. We booked a Junior Suite (35sqm) which had a small kitchen (2 hotplates, microwave, dishwasher, kettle, toaster and sink), fax machine, two large heaters, separate bathroom and toilet , flat screen TV and a large king bed. We had broadband internet access (although hotel charges tiered rates) and the staff were relatively helpful and friendly. We did have one issue with the car parking - the Agent's website (who receive their information directly from the hotel) advertised free parking, which was the primary reason for choosing this hotel. It turned out that the parking was actually 18 Euro per night, which equated to AUD90.00. As a gesture of goodwill, the hotel did not charge us for one night's parking, but it was disappointing to be so misled. Also, you need to have a small car - 4WD will not fit into the parking garage. The hotel is located 2mins walk from Alexanderplatz where you'll find trams, trains and buses (Just a hint - don't get a sightseeing bus for 20Euro each, just jump on either the number 100 or 200 bus from Alexanderplatz and it will take you all over the city for a fraction of the cost - minus the audio). The hotel's also located next to the Galleria, which has a massive food and deli section so taking advantage of the kitchen and making a home cooked meal is recommended if you've been travelling for a while. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for its fresh, new decor, the friendly staff and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lux11***GREAT***”
Reviews.Author: Dagobert00
Reviews.Content: Great design, comfortable rooms directly in the center. A lot of sights in the neighbourhood, bars and restaurants as well. The place to be in Berlin. The stuff was very helpful and friendly. The executive Suite we have stayed in was very luxury, clean and lightend. Absolutly great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- untrained staff”
Reviews.Author: Lugageboy
Reviews.Content: Cute designhotel located in Mitte, where things are happening at the moment in Berlin. The rooms are sweet and calm, and if you have a room to the backside you'll have a spacious balcony. Unfortunately the hotel has a very untrained staff that sometimes is unpolite and very inattentiv when there is a high pressure. I recommend it because of the location and that it's new and fresh, but not for a longer stay. I would also recommend to eat breakfast in some of the cafés in the area. Berlin is famous for it's nice breakfast and the hotel charge you 10€ per person for a very poor one with machine made coffee. For that price you get pancakes with fresh fruit and a freshly made cafe latte just around the corner. Don't use internet at the hotel, it's free at most cafés and the hotel charge 4€ an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value”
Reviews.Author: dontworrydontpanic
Reviews.Content: Great place - perfect for people who don't like feeling like they are just a number in a big hotel. the building is quiet and our "smart" room overlooked a quiet residential courtyard. the staff were fantastic - very friendly and always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the summer!”
Reviews.Author: curtains
Reviews.Content: In most respects this is a very good hotel with generally well equipped, good size rooms and great location. But had to mark this down since the rooms have no air-con - this is not made clear (& should be for a hotel of this standard), and results in the hotel being quite uncomfortable to stay during hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dobinn
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Lux 11. We chose an executive suite which is highly recommended as it gives quite a lot more space than the other apartments for not much more money. The whole building is very stylish but very relaxed. The location is great near to lots of good shopping, bars and restaurants. The staff were fantastic, very helpful. Very surprised by the negative comments about them. The only reasons I would not give an excellent rating is because there were some failings. The sink in the room looked amazing but only served up very hot water. Yes, it is an apartment but to not service the room for 3 days is awkward. The floors are painted light green so quickly get really dirty, the bin is small and so fills up (with no where to empty it downstairs/outside) etc.. I think if they were to consider a light clean every day and then change bedding every 3. Also not being able to buy simple stuff like water/wine in the hotel seems bizarre when there is a restaurant on the ground floor. There are a lot of rooms, surely a simple delivery service would make them money!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: nicefellowBielefeld
Reviews.Content: We had a fine 4 day stay ended with our departure this morning. We enjoyed the Lux very much. The room was very comfortable and attractively styled. The locatiln was superb. Wowever, what really made our stay so pleasant was the helpful and friendly attitude of the staff. We would be happy to recommend the house to our friends, the athmosphere is great, the kitchenette and the cleaning every third day make you feel like beeing home. This is what I expected when I booked an Apartmenthouse and not a hotel, it was so much fun. I also would recommend the Lux for business people, because it is so close to the center and you have a desk in every room.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design, but not for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: rrp20
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin on business, so stayed a night in the Lux 11 hotel. The hotel had been recommended to me by our German colleagues and from the website I was really looking forward to my stay. The location is excellent if you wish to explore everything that Berlin has to offer. However, I was here on business and just wanted a comfortable bed for the night, as I had an early start. The hotel looks incredibly stylish from the outside, and the rooms are also deliciously style conscious. The simple, sleek and elegant feel and look to the rooms makes them feel quite homely despite the lack of colour. The only drawback for me is that the hotel is geared towards the trendy traveller, rather than the functional business traveller. I arrived after the reception had closed, and the process of obtaining my room key was far from simple - I had to go to the restaurant and phone through my credit card details. The room is nice, but as I've said, not for the business traveller. I couldn't get an internet connection for my laptop and there was no room service - things that I'm sure the average tourist can live without. Breakfast on a morning is divine - although not included. It's definitely worth waking up for! Overall, a nice hotel in a good location that caters to its target market of the casual, style-conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Gelada
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel LUX 11, Jan 9-11, 2007. We really liked. The location is magnificent for anyone wishing to see Berlin: for museum and cultural events as well as for shopping. It is a design hotel: we liked the furniture/decoration and the overall hotel ambience. We liked the whole residence thing: not having cleaning ladies bagging to your door every day - waking you up. There was no noise at all. It was pleasently warm. Staff was very efficient. Value for money. We had a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nycedlee
Reviews.Content: Reasons why we will NEVER stayed at LuX 11, EVER AGAIN. Hotel staff is full of attitude. Concierge is not available 24 hours. The sink in the room is not practical at all. So is the shower. Water splashes everywhere whenever we take showers. No one is available to clean the daily garbage. No soundproof in the room. You can hear every single foot-step of people who live above you. Awful & Lousy!!! I WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “very unpleasant place”
Reviews.Author: luc-françois
Reviews.Content: very unfriendly staff. Strange rules, you can obtain your reserved room before 4PM. Not very clean, generally, this hotel looks already tired. Small room, cold atmosphere and a pretentious design without means for that. I don't understand why such a place is recommended by some of the prestigious traveller magazines.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute a great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Netherlands
Reviews.Content: STOP !! This is the place to be in Berlin. Great rooms great location. Really 5 star stuff. Very trendy rooms, great restaurants near by , friendly staff. You won't regret it !!

Reviews.Title: “Too less for the price”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Bateman
Reviews.Content: Below our room was a very noisy restaurant, so we didnt sleep well. The staff wasnt too friendly and the management neither. The furniture is nice and i really like design hotels. But even it is only one year old the roomy look very used still. The prices are very high so I wouldnt recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location w/ Small Compromises”
Reviews.Author: Home:NYC
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic 4-day stay at Lux 11. It's the absolute perfect location for anyone who wants to be in the center of Berlin's burgeoning creative scene. You'll be surrounded by high-style boutiques, hip restaurants, and cool nightclubs. Also near many U-Bahn and S-Bahn stops, so it's easy to get to all corners of the city. And the building is former housing for the secret police...a little bit of East Berlin history to add to the place's mystique. I have read most of the reviews here and think the people who hated it had the wrong expectations. One thing should be made very clear: this is not a 4-star hotel that will cater to your every need. There is no room service, no concierge, no minibar, and bed turndown/room cleaning is done every third day. Sounds odd for a hotel, but because these rooms are more like small apartments, it seems to work. You get a rather chic, fully stocked little kitchenette (all the tools you need to prepare a dinner for 4) and a good DVD/CD player. It's kinda like being home. Also, this is not the place to stay if you're sharing a room with friends or coworkers...or if you're shy. There is very little separating the shower and the bedroom (just a step up and a clear glass divider). Again, sounds odd, but I found the use of space and overall design to be artful and ingeneous. I was there during moderate weather in August, so air conditioning was not an issue. I found the rooms to be airy, light-filled (very high ceilings with lots of large windows), quiet, and extremely comfortable (great bed). When you do need maintenance of some sort, they are fast and efficient. When we arrived, there was a small problem with the window (not shutting all the way and letting in some street noise). The problem was fixed within 10 minutes and the room became silent (and we were on the first floor right above the street). It's a very solid building. Long story short: for the independent, unfussy, style-conscious traveler, Lux 11 is an excellent and affordable choice. Just know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, cool, conceptual, no air con, unconventional”
Reviews.Author: OPY
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel with a cool restaurant. Great location. I really enjoyed it, but would probably chose a different hotel for a short trip. The staff is young, German and hip. So don't expect stiff service. The room is stylish, some designs are useless though ( I nearly broke my arm every time I used the sink - you'll have to experience to understand this comment). It is an appartment hotel and you will get a good price if you stay more than just a few days. I don't understand the kitchen concept in there. No Air con - for americans not familiar with European hotels -> better not come here. Also I like my bed being made daily when I am on a short culture trip. So in all a little overdesigned, the appartment concept will soon be abandoned I guess. But it is a great place - it just fits the location: Berlin is young, improvising, experimental, relaxed, European, unconventional, multiculti, so utterly cool -> same is the LUX

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Urban76
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a stylish boutique hotel/appartment in Mitte (the place to be in Berlin), you should go for Lux 11. Excellent location, good service (though no room-service), very clean and reasonable in price.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: jason5080
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to me the first stop on a 3-leg European trip. As soon as I arrived I knew things were not going to go as planned. The front desk person informed me that there would be no towel or maid service and after checking into the room, I noticed there was no airconditioning--making the room unbearibly hot. There were also mildew stains on the uncomfortable concrete tub and the room was anything but warm and inviting. This place is a joke--I can't imagine anyone finding it alluring. The staff is unprofessional and unfriendly--the place has the charm of a prison. Within 5 minutes, I asked to check out. The front desk person pleaded with me to stay, but leaving was one of the smartest decisions I've ever made. Checked into the Westin--stayed in one of their brand new spa suites--and had one of the best stays of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: swiss-deluxe
Reviews.Content: We spent a whole week in this extravagant place and decided to book a junior suite for 165,00 EUR. Having been a guest in some other fine Berlin designhotels, I must say this one is by far the best. The staff is very, very professionel and catering to every need on request, and absolutely friendly. No matter whom you will meet, the bellboy, the ladies from the housekeeping or a manager everyone will wish you a good day. And it seemed to me, they really meant it - that was not just the result of good training. Everybody is rushing arround with a smile.... we like that very well and really felt home. The room was spacious, nicely decorated with a rooms-smell called callas, the bed perfect, two different choices shower-amenities (one for ladies and one for gentlemen). we've had a large flatscreen tv with a dvd player and we enjoyed our own cds when beeing in the room and no boring hotelradio or similar. The location is convenient and very hip: at the Hacksche Hoefe, directly in the mitte district. you can rush out of the hotel and you are immedialty in teh center of the hippest and coolest district of berlin. I can highly recommend this hotel! and, however, i've never seen so much beautiful, young and good looking people (all guest) in any other place i've been before. everybody is ultrastylish and look like models, actors and celebrities...

HotelInfo.Name: Lux 11
HotelInfo.Address: Rosa-Luxemburg-Strasse 9-13, 10178 Berlin, Germany
